title.narrative: Schools Capacity strengthening through rehabilitating existing spaces creating new spaces, provision of Wash works for the IPDs in Rural Damascus (Jaramana)

description.narrative: The ongoing conflict in Syria forces large numbers of families to leave their homes and take refuge in more protected areas. Many of these families arrive from the major urban areas and overpopulate suburban townships that house already thousands of IDPs and returnees. Seen the brutal armed conflict that hits particularly, but not exclusively most of the sub-urban neighborhoods of Damascus and Rural Damascus, hundreds of thousands residents flee the fighting and seek safer havens in close semi-urban or rural areas ,where most of them remain condemned to squat in unoccupied public or private buildings, open buildings sites. The most basic requirements besides (shelter, food, health) concerning the present emergency situation is the right to Education for children. The key barriers to fulfillment children's right to education schools and playgrounds are targeted and the choice about whether to send a child to school becomes a life or death choice. One quarter of all schools no longer function because they are damaged, destroyed or used as shelters to host families fleeing violence. After more than five years, the country is facing educational gaps and slow educational progress with severe protection needs .More than two million Syrian children have been forced to drop out of school because of displacement caused by the fighting, destruction or closure of schools, and lack of teachers. The conflict is also forcing children out of school in other ways: parents are killed by fighting, separation from family members, child labour to support their families girls are forced into early marriages, often by parents who hope this will help keep them safer from violence. The project aim is to create a safe environment for children to complete their education . Project objectives : The long term objective of the project is to contribute to strengthening the education system to respond to the needs of the students (girls and boys), improve their quality of life and ensure fulfillment of their basic human rights through increasing their access to education. This 12 month project is in line with the cluster specific objective for education "strengthen the capacity of the education system and communities to deliver a timely, coordinated and evidence based education response at national and sub –national levels", and child protection , wash objectives . Through rehabilitation of existing class rooms and creating new (prefabricated) classrooms and equipment. This action will create more opportunities for children to enroll in schools and protect them from joining the labour market at early age. Project Activities : The project will target 4 schools in R.Damacus ( Jarmana, Qudsaya) and the activities will include : - Provision of portable water through the installation of water treatment units. -W.C sanitation through proper solid waste evacuation and maintenance, provision of regular water supply. - Rehabilitation of existing classrooms and equipment. - Installation of prefabricated classrooms with the proper equipment.
